snippet: Christopher McCormack, a Bronx commander whose remarks about young black males were secretly recorded, testified that he would only relay victims’ descriptions to his officers.
abstract: Deputy Inspector Christopher McCormack, whose comments about race had been secretly recorded by a patrol officer, takes the stand in two-month-long racial profiling trial, but Judge, Shira A Scheindlin, instead rules that her interpretation of recorded discussion is what holds weight; McCormack testifies that his comments were descriptions of victims, not examples of racial profiling.
lead_paragraph: Christopher McCormack, a Bronx commander whose remarks about young black males were secretly recorded, testified that he would only relay victims’ descriptions to his officers.

headline.seo: Police Inspector Rules Out Racial Profiling
headline.main: Police Inspector Rules Out Racial Profiling
headline.print_headline: Police Inspector Rules Out Racial Profiling
